intro: Tithymalus longicruris, commonly known as the long-legged tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which attract various pollinators. Its leaves are usually finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens. Tithymalus longicruris thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
